result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain stable residence.

Hearing at 12-28-2015 09:45 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred deJunco of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Def has pending Jefferson Co case (15CF16).  Court sets $3000 cash bond.  SPD will appoint counsel.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 09:45 am.
